pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! 🐙
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1934094e-98db-497e-a0c8-6c6138305179) for commit b15b03e21cd7022d97d90ed9f02b4227698e5e91.Found no runs to compare against.
rebasing, because `!bench` was broken, so has nothing to compare against.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4eb54a06-948d-4bba-9986-c1eee74806fd) for commit 70d9b7c41feba01f6fbcd1ec58fe5f5977eada43.Found no runs to compare against.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4eb54a06-948d-4bba-9986-c1eee74806fd) for commit 70d9b7c41feba01f6fbcd1ec58fe5f5977eada43.Found no runs to compare against.

Great! It looks like not only are imports being reduced, but they also seem to be sorted as well? I was going to suggest that, but from a quick glance, it appears it's already being handled simultaneously.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d95d128d-a8e6-478b-8ac9-72f48fd50fab) for commit c112584ba23262b52b02f06d5205a6ef271c405c.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4f1ba7b4-5d33-420b-9a78-8c954eb869f1/to/d95d128d-a8e6-478b-8ac9-72f48fd50fab) against commit 23abd25cd2b3eea5c7353deec9b14b731ff33658.

> Great! It looks like not only are imports being reduced, but they also seem to be sorted as well? I was going to suggest that, but from a quick glance, it appears it's already being handled simultaneously.

Yeah, I saw https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16419, which is great! 
I hope that lands soon, so we can just have sorted imports to start with.
Many of the unsorted ones come from a time before we fixed how sorting is done in `min_imports`, I suspect.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/193edc53-e8bc-4e3a-b79e-1619f5542cc1) for commit bad053326451f9e9fd628ecc5427cde995187473.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4f1ba7b4-5d33-420b-9a78-8c954eb869f1/to/193edc53-e8bc-4e3a-b79e-1619f5542cc1) against commit 23abd25cd2b3eea5c7353deec9b14b731ff33658:
```diff
  Benchmark      Metric       Change
  ============================================
+ open Mathlib   wall-clock    -5.6% (-17.8 σ)
```

This is very promising: a 5.6% reduction in wall-time for open Mathlib (-17.8 sigma!) simply by minimizing the imports in `Mathlib/Algebra`. It will be interesting to see what reductions we can achieve in other directories with upcoming PRs.

pullRequest.title: chore(Mathlib/Algebra): minimize imports

Great! It looks like not only are imports being reduced, but they also seem to be sorted as well? I was going to suggest that, but from a quick glance, it appears it's already being handled simultaneously.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d95d128d-a8e6-478b-8ac9-72f48fd50fab) for commit c112584ba23262b52b02f06d5205a6ef271c405c.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4f1ba7b4-5d33-420b-9a78-8c954eb869f1/to/d95d128d-a8e6-478b-8ac9-72f48fd50fab) against commit 23abd25cd2b3eea5c7353deec9b14b731ff33658.

> Great! It looks like not only are imports being reduced, but they also seem to be sorted as well? I was going to suggest that, but from a quick glance, it appears it's already being handled simultaneously.

Yeah, I saw https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16419, which is great! 
I hope that lands soon, so we can just have sorted imports to start with.
Many of the unsorted ones come from a time before we fixed how sorting is done in `min_imports`, I suspect.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/193edc53-e8bc-4e3a-b79e-1619f5542cc1) for commit bad053326451f9e9fd628ecc5427cde995187473.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4f1ba7b4-5d33-420b-9a78-8c954eb869f1/to/193edc53-e8bc-4e3a-b79e-1619f5542cc1) against commit 23abd25cd2b3eea5c7353deec9b14b731ff33658:
```diff
  Benchmark      Metric       Change
  ============================================
+ open Mathlib   wall-clock    -5.6% (-17.8 σ)
```

This is very promising: a 5.6% reduction in wall-time for open Mathlib (-17.8 sigma!) simply by minimizing the imports in `Mathlib/Algebra`. It will be interesting to see what reductions we can achieve in other directories with upcoming PRs.
